member.summary: Represents a format information object that uses "on" and "off" state to format a graph.

member.summary: Indicates whether the formatter will emit size part. By default the value is .

member.name: P:Puzzles.Hamiltonian.Concepts.Formatting.OnOffGraphFormatInfo.ParsingFormatPattern
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^(\\d+):(\\d+)(:([01]{4,}))?$
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match a Unicode digit atomically at least once.
○ Match ':'.
○ 2nd capture group.
○ Match a Unicode digit greedily at least once.
○ Optional (greedy).
○ 3rd capture group.
○ Match ':'.
○ 4th capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [01] greedily at least 4 times.
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Hamiltonian.Concepts.Graph.Empty(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates an empty graph with the specified number of rows and columns.

remarks.para:
Meaning:
row: The number of rows is row.
column: The number of columns is column.
data: Detail of on/off graph sequence (Use characters '0' and '1'; 0 - used, 1 - unused).
colon token ':': Separator.
data can be omitted. If data is omitted, the generated graph will set all cells "off".
